section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: This hands-on programming section explores variables and data types in Python, featuring interactive exercises to build foundational coding skills.
learning_objectives: Students will be able to declare and assign variables using Python syntax.
Students will identify and utilize basic data types including integers, floats, strings, and booleans.
Students will perform simple operations and conversions between data types.
Students will debug common errors related to variables and data types.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will learn to declare, assign, and modify variables in Python code.

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write a Python script to declare a variable named 'name' and assign it your name as a string, then print it using print().
Create a variable 'age' with an integer value, print it, then reassign it to age + 1 and print the new value.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will distinguish between integers and floats and perform basic arithmetic operations.

exercises.exercise_instructions: Declare two integer variables, add them together, and store the result in a new variable, then print the result.
Use two float variables to compute their division and modulus, printing both results to the console.
Assign a number to a variable, check if it's an integer using isinstance(), and print the result.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will manipulate strings and use boolean values in conditional expressions.

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create two string variables for first and last name, concatenate them with a space, and print the full name.
Declare an integer variable, compare it to 10 using ==, assign the boolean result to a variable, and print it.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will convert between data types and apply best practices for variable usage.

exercises.exercise_instructions: Take a string variable representing a number, convert it to an integer using int(), add 5, and print the result.
Attempt to add a string and an integer, handle the error by converting the string to float first, then print the sum.
Write a short script using descriptive variable names and comments to calculate the area of a rectangle with given length and width.
